S. African President Supports Efforts for Inter-Korean Reconciliation and Reunification 
    Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The South African government will make efforts for the development of the relations between South Africa and the DPRK and their common interests, said South African President Thabo Mbuyelwa Mbeki when receiving credentials from the DPRK ambassador to South Africa on Oct. 27.
 He expressed support to the efforts of the north and the south of Korea for reconciliation and reunification, hoping that such process would continue.

Message of Sympathy to Nigerian President 
    Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of sympathy to Olusegun Obasanjo, president of the Federal Republic of Nigeria.
 The message expressed deep sympathy and consolation to the president and, through him, to the dead and their bereaved families upon hearing the sad news that a recent airliner crash in Nigeria claimed big casualties.

New Shock Wave Renal Calculus Crusher Developed
    Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The Physical Engineering Department of Kim Chaek University of Technology has made a shock wave renal calculus crusher which can strike calculus from outside of the body.
 It has a function to pursue the renal calculus automatically and to draw up and save the data and picture of the treatment.    
 As the crusher not only spots all kinds of calculi but also automatically pursues the stones moving in the kidney by the respiration of the patient and shock wave with the help of computer, there is not accidental but almost successful in strike.
 The even and accurate shock waves give no treatment burden to the patients.
 Each treatment takes 30 to 40 minutes. In case of 0.5-2 centimeters of calculus the crushing rate is more than 90 percent. It needs three or four times of treatment but one time is enough according to circumstances.    
 For its high treatment efficiency and low production cost, the crusher is hailed by hospitals.

Greetings to Dominican President
    Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Dominican President Nicholas Liverpool on the occasion of the 28th anniversary of the independence of the Commonwealth of Dominica.
 The message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the mutual interests in the future.
